page.title: 19DEWSBURY MOOR BRANCH LIBRARY
page.content: We are five pupils from St.John's Infant's School, Dewsbury Moor who decided to investigate the{local {branch library.}We found out that the building was officially opened on 5 May, 1956 at a cost of Â£6,504. There are{16,000 books,}most of which are{fiction.}There is also a small non-fiction section which includes, amongst other things, books on travel, sport, technology, the arts and nature. Several local street maps and directories are also kept for {reference}purposes. At present there are 2,360 tickets in use with approximately{500 borrowers}a week. Around fifteen new members join each week. The library is not computerised. It is open every afternoon except Tuesdays and Sundays. By:- Sarah Senior, Lee Beal, Michael Jackson, Helen Jones & Michael Houzam.
